sourcing.instructions: C: Graphite powder can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online. Ce: Cerium oxide is available from chemical suppliers. Pb: Lead metal can be obtained from specialized metal suppliers. Tb: Terbium oxide can be found from rare earth material suppliers.
steps: C: Graphite powder can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online. Ce: Cerium oxide is available from chemical suppliers. Pb: Lead metal can be obtained from specialized metal suppliers. Tb: Terbium oxide can be found from rare earth material suppliers.

1. Measure 12.0 g of graphite powder (C). 2. Weigh 6.0 g of cerium oxide (Ce). 3. Weigh 18.0 g of lead metal (Pb). 4. Measure 12.0 g of terbium oxide (Tb). 5. Combine all materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to ensure a homogeneous blend.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 12.0 g of graphite powder (C). 2. Weigh 6.0 g of cerium oxide (Ce). 3. Weigh 18.0 g of lead metal (Pb). 4. Measure 12.0 g of terbium oxide (Tb). 5. Combine all materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to ensure a homogeneous blend.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed materials into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to a temperature of 900째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and fusion of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed materials into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to a temperature of 900째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and fusion of the materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. This cooling process should take about 4-6 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. This cooling process should take about 4-6 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surface of the sample if necessary. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and appearance.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the surface of the sample if necessary. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and appearance.
